name: Hotel Hermitage Barriere

reviews.text: Found previous reviewer's comments fair. It is very expensive for individual travellers. Corporate customers must get very good rates - there were three large groups there when we left after a four day stay.
reviews.title: Needs investment

likes.disliked: — Worn look in room, expensive breakfast / dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were excellent throughout the hotel. They were well trained up to international hotel standards. This was evidenced by the "Saturday Night Experience" - a leak in the swimming pool caused an electric short circuit and blacked out the hotel for most of the evening. The fire was contained to a small area, however eight fire, police, edf units arrived within minutes. The staff evacuated the hotel in an extremely professional manner. All the emergency systems worked - an extremely reassuring event in hotels - see attached photo.
reviews.title: Really, not worth it!

reviews.text: As previous reviewer said, parts of hotel not only had a dated look, but some room furniture had an overuse look - scuffs around tables, sag in bed... Also, Wifi in the lobby only, not in the rooms - only a very expensive direct connection Internet system in the rooms! The hotel really needs investment.
reviews.title: niche belle epoque hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we would certainly stay there again at the right price, the excellent location and staff make up for the shortcomings.
reviews.title: Hotel Standards Did Not Justify Prices Charged

likes.disliked: — Way overpriced for a Hotel of this standard

reviews.text: I've got a lot to say about this hotel. I hope to help people not make the same mistake we feel we did. Probably about $1000 worth.
reviews.title: Expensive; good hotel but 4 star not 5 star

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night on 27 July. Had booked a "Double Deluxe sea view" at a price of EUR 555 (approx USD 750) room only (one of their most expensive room category). The room was one of the smallest (approx. 10 sqm) I haver seen in years of travelling all around the world. Absolutely amazing considering the price. Wanted to give my family a treat and ended-up absolutely disappointed. The only positive note: a very professional, smiling and efficient service. For a delicious dinner I highly recommend "La Maison Blanche" in the city center.
reviews.title: Deluxe prices, worst room size ever

reviews.text: Easy to find the hotel. It is located next to the beach. Large building, very elegant lounge, it has a nice bar and restaurant. Still staying at the positve experiences, it has a lovely rstaurant on the beach too, good wine list, great food and obviously pricey.
reviews.title: elegant and overpriced
loved l'hermitage
reviews.text: It is not the wothiness of the hotel but there are plenty of sport facilities and opportunities on the beach. Several size catamarans, windsurf, jet-sky and a very stylish leasure in the morning: galopping in the ocean alone! In the nearby there is a horse school, 1h group tour to the beach costs EUR 20, accompanied only by a guide, it was EUR 55. If you never tried and you are not a beginner: do it, stunning experience.

description: Magnificent white Anglo Norman style building facing the sea. The hotel Hermitage Barriere features 207 rooms and suites and offers direct access to the most beautiful beach in Europe. 300m from Casino de La Baule, the Thalgo La Baule thalassotherapy centre and the Tennis Country Club Barriere. 800m from the town centre. 2 restaurants, La Terrasse and Eden Beach, 2 heated saltwater swimming pools, one indoor and one outdoor, fitness room and bar.
